page.title: 08Sheerwater Estate, Woking.
page.content: The Sheerwater Estate is a very well planned estate built after the 1939-45 War as a London overspill area. It extends between the West Byfleet Golf Course and the Basingstoke Canal. The main through road is Albert Drive. There are flats, semi-detached and detached houses. There is a Business Park with many spacious factories, including Thorn EMI and Oxy Metal Industries. All the factories are for light industries. The shopping parade has all the usual shops, two churches and a small car park. For the residents the Council provides a Community Centre, Athletic Ground and two State Schools. The Sheerwater Estate provides every- thing the public requires including green space and tree-lined roads.
